DOC.brief_summary: To show superiority safety Smoflipid Intralipid® measure number study patient treatment group conjugate bilirubin exceed 2 mg/dL first 28 day study treatment , confirm second sample collect 7 day first sample .
DOC.brief_title: Phase 3 Study Compare Safety Efficacy Smoflipid 20 % Intralipid 20 % Hospitalized Neonates Infants
DOC.criteria: Neonates infant , expect require parenteral nutrition ( PN ) 28 day Postmenstrual age ≥ 24 week Birth weight ≥ 750g Gastroschisis , duodenal , jejunal ileal atresia , volvulus , spontaneous intestinal perforation necrotizing enterocolitis ( Bell 's stage 2B high ) At least 80 % nutritional need baseline receive PN Signed date informed consent obtain least one parent legal guardian Conjugated bilirubin > 0.6 mg/dL Any known pre , intra posthepatic complication increase conjugate bilirubin level > 0.6 , mg/dL study participation Suspected liver disease liver damage base either aspartate aminotransferase ( AST ) , alanine aminotransferase ( ALT ) , gammaglutamyl transferase ( GGT ) exceed 2.5x upper limit normal range Active bloodstream infection demonstrate positive blood culture screen Cystic fibrosis Meconium ileus Serum triglyceride level > 250 mg/dL Cyanotic congenital heart defect Severe renal failure serum creatinine > 2.0 mg/dL History shock require vasopressor Anasarca Extracorporeal Membrane Oxygenation ( ECMO ) Known inborn error metabolism Known congenital viral infection Unlikely survive longer 28 day Known hypersensitivity fish , egg , soya peanut protein active substance excipients
